body: Tell me your greatest startup tip in one tweet.

5 tips for marketing your startup's newsletter:

- SEO optimize your newsletter content & publish it on your website
- Distribute them across other channels
- Launch your newsletter as a product
- Share it on social media as handcrafted posts
- Submit it to newsletter directories

Are you growing a startup?

If so, the people you hire will be the make or break of your business growth. 

Here are 5 tips to create a positive company culture.

//THREAD//

5 marketing tips for growing your startup:

1. Buildd your audience before you start building your product
2. Launch on multiple channels
3. Spend 90% of your time on distribution & 10% on creation
4. Focus on SEO from day 1
5. Buildd trust by providing value selflessly

Any B2B startups have a new blog or podcast? Cleansing my timeline with wholesome, worklife tips and best practices!

New week, new job! I started as an associate editor at @endpts today, where I’ll continue reporting on the people, $$$, science & biotech startups behind the drug development industry. Send tips & story ideas to klahucik@endpointsnews.com !
Very excited to welcome @biancahealey to the @SmartCompany team today! Send her your great tips for tech and startup stories!

Joined an early-stage startup as a social media strategist.

Any tips for me?👋

Pro tip for startup founders:

Give each of your 100 first paying customers advisory share grants. 

Each grant could even be 0.0001% of the company. 

Amount doesn’t matter as much as buying their loyalty….permanently

Passing on founders is one of the hardest parts about VC. A tip to making it more bearable while also helping them on their journeys:

Offer to make intros to other VCs.

Even if the startup isn’t a fit for your firm, it could be an excellent fit for another. Spread the love!

My #1 early stage founder tip:

Your startup is dead by default (to people who have millions of things going in their lives)

It is your job daily to resurrect it

and make it worth remembering by telling stories, building in public, offering value etc

A tip to breaking into VC:

Start acting like a VC before you are one. 

Network, source & share deal flow, evaluate startups, help founders, build your thesis. Operate for the job you want, not the one you’re in.

gm @warikoo ser

Starting my internship at this really really cool startup as a generalist today :)

Got any advice/tips on how can I deliver my best in it?

@NikitaRaikwarCo 1- Where do you get most of your clients from? 
2- I just tried out Linkedin recently, no luck since i mostly work with individual clients and not businesses. Any tips to get hired by startups? 
3- How much time do you take to craft a 1000 word article? 
4- What's your avg rate?

3. How do you deal with failure? I strongly believe in life / startups being a long game, and there will inevitably be failures along the way. I’ve had a decent # already. Any tips/tricks for getting through them mentally & emotionally?

Happy about the 0% churn rate on my new SaaS.

Tip you can follow: Delete “Unsubscribe” option

Ninja 🥷🏼 Startup Fundraising Tip: Buy targeted adds on Facebook/social media for the VCs you want to raise from right before going out.

Copywriting Tip 

Niche down and single out your target audience. 

Make it feel like your product is made just for them. 

Remember — when you sell to everyone, you sell to no one. 

Ex:

• I make websites for startups ❌ 

• I make e-commerce websites for fashion startups ✅

That's all guys

Hello #BelfastHour has anyone got any tips for a startup business like mine? Trying to find ways of getting to word of mouth. I get some reviews on the nextdoor app but work coming in is a little slow.

General tip for those getting jobs in Tech startups.

Equity and stock options are generally not comparable.

Show me a startup that knows their customer deeply and uses that to inform their sales and marketing, and I'll tell you it's a company that is likely to succeed.

A few tips to help you get there 👇
